FOREWORD

Lewis, Richard Webb and Devesh Kapur, The World Bank: Its First Half Century, Washington, DC: Brookings Institution Press, 1997. It is not a formal oral history, and it is not a systematic overview of the work of the person interviewed. SARDJONO: Management reform.

But how to set the level in every functional groups, sometimes you have different ideas with them, of course, because World Bank is comprised of experts and we are also comprised of experts. No, but finally, finally the decision is the government.

SARDJONO: Yes.

The government has promulgated the Government Regulation Number 18 in the year 1972. We were able to provide PLN organization into that capability. So the government provided these facilities.
At the same time we have succeeded recruitment of our young engineers at that time-- now they are already experts--but in the early â€˜70s, thatâ€™s the area.

doc.abstracts: In November 1991, Ir. Sardjono was interviewed on behalf of the World Bank Group Archives oral history program by John Lewis, Richard Webb, Devesh Kapur. Mr. Sardjono served the Bank as a director of finance and commerce from 1970-1972; as the director of operations from 1972-1975; as the director of planning in perusahaan listrik negara (PLN) from 1975-1980; as the president director from 1980-1990. He retired in 1990. This transcript concerns a loan from International Development Association (IDA); energy projects; and disputes or discussions with the World Bank on the entry of the private sector.
